intro: Corydalis solida var. linearis, commonly known as the linear corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to regions of Asia, including China and Korea, this species thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and woodland settings.
